intro: Lesquerella pinetorum, commonly known as the pine forest lesquerella, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils within forested areas, often near pine trees. Lesquerella pinetorum produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
